title: Raiders' Trent Brown is sued for domestic violence by his ex-girlfriend
text:
Oakland Raiders player Trent Brown is being sued for domestic violence by his ex-girlfriend, who claims the 6-foot-8, 350-pound right tackle left her 'bruised, bloodied and battered' and fearing for her own life after several attacks.

In the lawsuit filed in Alameda County, California Superior Court and obtained by the Daily Mail, Diorra Marzette-Sanders claims Brown punched and choked her over the course of multiple incidents, beginning in 2018.

In one 2018 incident at a restaurant, Brown allegedly 'slapped the Plaintiff across the face leaving her mouth bloody and her face bruised,' according to the lawsuit.

Raiders right tackle Trent Brown is being sued for domestic violence by his ex-girlfriend

In another incident in March of 2019, the two got into an argument and Brown allegedly jumped at Marzette-Sanders, grabbing her face and covering her mouth while 'choking her out until she couldn't breath,' according to the lawsuit. She was allegedly left with a ring of bruises around her neck.

She also claims that in April of 2019, while vacationing in Hawaii, Brown locked her in a room, slapped her across the face and punched her in the ribs.

Marzette-Sanders filed the report following an incident in June in which Brown allegedly left her arm bruised.

She gave birth to the couple's first child in January, nearly two years after they began dating, according to the lawsuit.

When Marzette-Sanders threatened to leave him with their son, Brown allegedly told her: 'I'll shoot yo ass in the f***ing head before you walk out that door with my son.'

The lawsuit claims that the couple made a non-marital partnership agreement earlier in their relationship, indicating that they would remain a couple for the rest of their lives and start a family. Furthermore, she promised to give up her life in Oakland to take care of their future children.

Marzette-Sanders is requesting a jury trial as well as unspecified compensation. She is also accusing him of misleading her about his plans to marry her.

The 26-year-old Brown is signed to a four-year, $66 million contract and has started in all five of the Raiders' games so far this season.

Brown could be subject to the NFL's personal conduct policy regardless of whether he is officially charged.
